steps.title: Your Hard-Won Skills
steps.narration: Over the past five weeks, you've learned what seniors know: codebase navigation, data flow tracing, integration patterns, and design-first thinking. These aren't just skills‚Äîthey're superpowers.

steps.title: AI's Raw Power
steps.narration: AI can generate code, explain concepts, refactor patterns, and write tests at incredible speed. But without context, it's just guessing. It doesn't know your codebase or your requirements.

steps.title: You Provide Context
steps.narration: This is where you shine. You give AI the context it needs: codebase patterns, design constraints, edge cases, and integration requirements. Context transforms AI from guessing to executing.

steps.title: AI Executes
steps.narration: With proper context, AI executes your vision at machine speed. Code generation, boilerplate, transformations‚Äîtasks that took hours now take minutes.

steps.title: Senior-Level Output
steps.narration: The result? Senior-level productivity. Your knowledge plus AI's speed equals work that would take others days compressed into hours. You're not replaced‚Äîyou're amplified!

steps.title: Phase 1: You Design
steps.narration: Every great AI collaboration starts with you. Requirements, diagrams, edge cases‚Äîthis is where your brain matters. AI can't know what the business needs. You do.

steps.title: Phase 2: You Prompt
steps.narration: Break your design into clear, specific prompts. Include context from your codebase. Specify constraints and patterns to follow. A great prompt is half the work.

steps.title: Phase 3: AI Executes
steps.narration: AI generates code based on your prompt. It's fast and often impressive. But here's the key: trust but verify. AI output is a first draft, not a final answer.

steps.title: Phase 4: You Verify
steps.narration: This is critical. Does the code match your design? Does it handle your edge cases? Does it follow your codebase patterns? Your verification catches what AI misses.

steps.title: Phase 5: You Integrate
steps.narration: Adapt AI output to your codebase style. Connect it to existing code. Add what AI missed. This integration step is where your codebase knowledge pays off.

steps.title: Phase 6: You Test
steps.narration: AI often misses edge cases. Write tests yourself, or have AI generate them‚Äîbut verify every assertion. Testing is where you ensure quality matches your standards.

steps.title: Ship It!
steps.narration: You direct, AI executes, you verify. That's the loop. Master it, and you'll ship features faster than anyone thought possible while maintaining quality.

steps.title: Week Zero: Where You Started
steps.narration: Six weeks ago, you wrote code for tickets. You debugged with print statements. You copied API examples. You coded first and thought later. Sound familiar?

steps.title: You Learned Navigation
steps.narration: You can now read any codebase. Trace any call stack. Find any dependency. You're not lost in unfamiliar code anymore‚Äîyou're at home.

steps.title: You Learned Data Flow
steps.narration: You trace data flows systematically now. From user click to database and back. No more guessing where bugs come from‚Äîyou find them methodically.

steps.title: You Learned Integration
steps.narration: You integrate with resilience patterns. Timeouts, retries, circuit breakers. Your code doesn't just work‚Äîit handles failure gracefully.

steps.title: You Learned Design
steps.narration: You design before coding now. Diagrams, edge cases, interfaces. When you open your IDE, you already know what you're building.

steps.title: Week Six: Who You've Become
steps.narration: You're an engineer who owns features end-to-end, partners with AI, and executes at ten-x speed. The title will catch up to the skills. Keep going‚Äîyou've earned this!

questions.question: What makes AI 10x more powerful when you use it?
options: Using the most expensive AI model
Providing context: codebase patterns, constraints, and edge cases
Letting AI make all the decisions
Copying AI output without changes
questions.explanation: Your context is what transforms AI from guessing to executing. Without your knowledge of the codebase and requirements, AI is just making educated guesses.

questions.question: What is the 'magic formula' for senior-level productivity?
options: More hours + more coffee
Your knowledge + AI's speed
AI alone without human input
Copying senior engineers' code
questions.explanation: You provide the knowledge (context, patterns, constraints) and AI provides the speed (code generation, transformations). Together, you're faster than either alone.

questions.question: Why can't AI replace engineers who use AI effectively?
options: AI is too slow
AI doesn't understand business requirements or codebase context
AI costs too much
AI only works in certain languages
questions.explanation: AI doesn't know what the business needs or how your specific codebase works. You provide that irreplaceable context‚ÄîAI amplifies your capabilities, not replaces them.

questions.question: In the AI-paired workflow, which phases are HUMAN responsibilities?
options: Only design
Only testing
Design, prompt, verify, integrate, and test
None‚ÄîAI handles everything
questions.explanation: AI only executes (phase 3). You handle design, prompting, verification, integration, and testing. You're the architect; AI is the builder.

questions.question: What does 'trust but verify' mean in AI-paired development?
options: Trust AI completely and ship immediately
Never use AI because it makes mistakes
Let AI generate code, but always check it matches your design and handles edge cases
Only trust AI for simple tasks
questions.explanation: AI output is a first draft, not a final answer. Always verify that generated code matches your design, handles edge cases, and follows codebase patterns.

questions.question: Why is the 'prompt' phase so important?
options: It's not important‚ÄîAI figures it out
A clear prompt with context is half the work; it determines AI output quality
Prompts should be as short as possible
You should never include codebase context
questions.explanation: A great prompt includes clear requirements, relevant context from your codebase, and constraints to follow. This guides AI to produce useful, accurate output.

questions.question: What's the biggest mindset shift from junior to senior engineer?
options: Writing more code faster
Owning outcomes end-to-end, not just completing tasks
Memorizing more documentation
Working longer hours
questions.explanation: Seniors own features end-to-end‚Äîfrom design through deployment. They think about outcomes and impact, not just task completion.

questions.question: According to the course, when will you get the 'senior' title?
options: After exactly 5 years of experience
When you prove the skills‚Äîthe title catches up
When you memorize all the frameworks
Never‚Äîtitles don't matter
questions.explanation: The title catches up to the skills. You've developed senior-level skills‚Äînow go prove them through your work, and the recognition will follow.

questions.question: What should you do with every ticket going forward?
options: Just write the code as fast as possible
Ask clarifying questions, draw diagrams, map data flows, use AI with context
Wait for detailed specifications
Copy code from similar features
questions.explanation: Every ticket is a chance to practice senior-level skills: clarify before coding, diagram before implementing, trace data flows, and use AI with proper context and verification.
